column8: Jacob Frankfort arrived in Pueblo de Los Ángeles; first known Jew in the city
First Jewish worship service held in Los Angeles
Hebrew Benevolent Society founded (first Jewish charitable organization in LA)
First Jewish cemetery established at Chavez Ravine
Congregation B’nai B’rith chartered (later Wilshire Boulevard Temple)
First synagogue building completed at Temple & Broadway
Second B’nai B’rith synagogue built at 9th & Hope
Home of Peace Cemetery established (remains moved from Chavez Ravine)
Wilshire Boulevard Temple completed with Byzantine Revival dome
Hillside Memorial Park Jewish cemetery opened
Immigration of Iranian Jews after Iranian Revolution
Last comprehensive Jewish population survey conducted
Jewish population estimate for Los Angeles city
Brandeis Study of Jewish LA highlights immigrant origins (Iran, Israel, Russia, Latin America, Europe)
